intro: Colubrina longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters. The berries are a valuable food source for birds and are also used in traditional herbal medicine.
